main.java.gui

Class EditRulePopup

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.gui.EditRulePopup

  • public class EditRulePopup
extends java.lang.Object
    GUI pop-up responsible for allowing the user to edit and add different rules for visualising the excel table.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.swing.JPanel addNewRuleConditionPanel
      The JPanel to display the interface to add a new rule condition in Basic Mode
      private boolean advancedMode
      If the GUI is on Advanced Mode
      private javax.swing.JButton advancedModeButton
      The Save rule button
      private javax.swing.JPanel centerPanel
      The JPanel for the content in the center of the GUI
      private javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> comparisonOperatorListBox
      The Combo Box displaying the available comparison operators for rule creation in Basic Mode
      private javax.swing.JPanel controlPanel
      The JPanel to display the action buttons (Clear/Delete/Save)
      private boolean defaultRule
      If the rule being edited is a Default Rule

      The Delete rule button

      The JPanel to display the buttons to switch between Basic and Advanced modes
      private javax.swing.JFrame frame
      The frame of the rule edition GUI

      The Combo Box displaying the options of logical operators available for rule creation (AND, OR), for Basic Mode

      The main JPanel of the GUI

      The Combo Box displaying the available metrics for rule creation (LOC, CYCLO, ATFD, LAA), for Basic Mode

      The JPanel to display the rule's name
      private CodeQualityRule rule
      The rule being edited or created
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ruleConditions
      An array of string with the rules conditions where every position is a new line in the condition

      The JPanel to display the current rule conditions added in Basic Mode
      private javax.swing.JPanel ruleConditionsPanel
      The JPanel to display the rule's conditions
      private javax.swing.JTextField ruleNameField
      The rule name text field in the GUI
      private javax.swing.JTextArea ruleTextArea
      The Text Area the displays the rule conditions and that can be edited by the user on Advanced Mode
      private javax.swing.JButton saveButton
      The Save rule button

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditRulePopup

        public EditRulePopup(CodeQualityRule r)
        Constructs and initializes the GUI pop-up. It opens the Basic or Advanced Mode depending on the rule it's using.
        Parameters:
        r - - receives a rule for edition

    • Method Detail

      • createMainPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createMainPanel()
        Returns the JPanel where all other JPanels are nested
        Returns:
        JPanel - the panel which shows the EditRule GUI

      • createNamePanel

        private void createNamePanel()
        Creates the JPanel responsible for holding the rule's name. In case of a default rule, name is a non editable text field because it cannot be changed.

      • createCenterPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createCenterPanel()
        Returns the JPanel responsible for holding both the ruleConditionsPanel, which allows edits to the current rule, and the complexity toggle panel, which allows changing in between the Basic and Advanced modes.
        Returns:
        JPanel centerPanel - the panel at the center which occupies most of the rule edition GUI

      • createRuleConditionsPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createRuleConditionsPanel()
        Returns the JPanel responsible for holding both the current list of rule conditions, and the line which allows the addition of more conditions. In advanced mode, this panel holds a JTextArea, which can be freely edited by the user.
        Returns:
        JPanel ruleConditionsPanel - panel within the centerPanel which holds the rules conditions. Varies depending on being in advanced or basic mode

      • createAddRuleConditionPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createAddRuleConditionPanel()
        Returns the JPanel holding the line which allows users to add new rule conditions into the rule's conditions list. For Basic Mode.
        Returns:
        JPanel addNewRuleConditionPanel - the panel in basic mode which allows user to create conditions and shows new rule conditions when these are added

      • createEditorComplexityTogglePanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createEditorComplexityTogglePanel()
        Returns the JPanel which holds the buttons to switch between advanced and basic modes.
        Returns:
        JPanel editorComplexityTogglePanel - Panel which allows the user to toggle between basic and advanced modes

      • createControlPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel createControlPanel()
        Returns the JPanel responsible for holding the JButtons which allow all rule conditions to be cleared, and rule to be saved or deleted.
        Returns:
        JPanel controlPanel - Panel which allows the user to clear metrics, delete rule or save it

      • initializePanels

        private void initializePanels()
        Initialises all the JPanels at once.

      • fillRuleConditionsListPanel

        private void fillRuleConditionsListPanel()
        Fills the rule's conditions list in the UI with the contents found in the ruleConditions ArrayList.

      • clearRuleConditionsListPanel

        private void clearRuleConditionsListPanel()
        Clears all current rule conditions from both the GUI and the ruleConditions ArrayList.

      • setLogicalOperatorBoxVisibility

        private void setLogicalOperatorBoxVisibility()
        Handles setting the visibility of the Logical Operator ComboBox in the line responsible for allowing the user to add new rule conditions to the list. Basically, it stops the first rule condition, and the first rule condition only, from having an AND or an OR attached to it.

      • showMessage

        public void showMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Method that generates an alert with the received message
        Parameters:
        message - - a String with the expected message

      • getFrame

        public javax.swing.JFrame getFrame()
        Returns the rule edition GUI frame
        Returns:
        JFrame frame - the GUI for the rule edition popup

      • getLogicalOperator

        public javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> getLogicalOperator()
        Returns the JComboBox which holds the logical operators for a new rule condition (AND and OR).
        Returns:
        logicalOperatorListBox - the combobox with the 2 available logical operators

      • getMetrics

        public javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> getMetrics()
        Returns the JComboBox which holds the values for metrics (LOC, LAA, etc).
        Returns:
        metricsListBox - the combobox with the available metrics

      • getComparison

        public javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> getComparison()
        Returns the JComboBox which holds the possible comparisons for a new operator
        Returns:
        comparisonOperatorListBox - the combobox with the available comparison operators

        Returns:

      • getRawRuleConditions

        public java.lang.String getRawRuleConditions()
        Get the correct rule conditions, based on edition mode enabled, with no parsing of the string.
        Returns:
        rawRuleConditions - The rule conditions string with no parsing
